sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_1: Find the derivative of the function f(x) = 4x^7 using the power rule of differentiation.
message_2:
To find the derivative of the function f(x) = 4x^7 using the power rule of differentiation, we apply the rule:

(d/dx) (x^n) = n * x^(n-1)

In this case, n = 7. So, the derivative of f(x) = 4x^7 is:

f'(x) = 4 * 7 * x^(7-1)
f'(x) = 28 * x^6
